00020 TEST(BasicTests, PolyConstantBasic) {
00021 
00022     //System sys;
00023     // set sampling rate to 1 for testing
00024     SystemPtr sys(new System(44100, 8));
00025 
00026     PolyConstant gen1(sys); 
00027     EXPECT_EQ(gen1.getPolySize(), 0);
00028 
00029     EXPECT_EQ(gen1.getName(), "PolyConstant");
00030 
00031     std::vector<double> inputVector1;
00032     inputVector1.push_back(4);
00033     inputVector1.push_back(5);
00034 
00035     gen1.setParameter(aw::pNameValue, inputVector1);
00036 
00037     // poly size is set to size of input
00038     EXPECT_EQ(gen1.getPolySize(), 2);
00039 
00040 
00041     std::vector<double> inputVector2;
00042     inputVector2.push_back(23);
00043     inputVector2.push_back(55);
00044     inputVector2.push_back(98);
00045 
00046     gen1.setParameter(aw::pNameValue, inputVector2);
00047 
00048     // poly size is set to size of input
00049     EXPECT_EQ(gen1.getPolySize(), 3);
00050 
00051 
00052     // can set with a string
00053     std::string inputString1("3, 4, 5, 20");
00054     gen1.setParameter(aw::pNameValue, inputString1);
00055 
00056     // poly size is set to size of input
00057     EXPECT_EQ(gen1.getPolySize(), 4);
00058 
00059     std::string inputString2("53,24,15,20,1230,60234");
00060     gen1.setParameter(aw::pNameValue, inputString2);
00061     // poly size is set to size of input
00062     EXPECT_EQ(gen1.getPolySize(), 6);
00063 
00064 
00065     // setting with a character array
00066     gen1.setParameter(aw::pNameValue, "6,5");
00067     // poly size is set to size of input
00068     EXPECT_EQ(gen1.getPolySize(), 2);
00069 
00070 
00071     gen1.setParameter(aw::pNameValue, "1, 2, 3,   5,   7, 8");
00072     // poly size is set to size of input
00073     EXPECT_EQ(gen1.getPolySize(), 6);
00074 
00075 
00076     // get the pointer to the working array
00077     // double value_[aw::maximumPolySize]
00078     double* workingArray1 = gen1.getPolyAtSample(0);
00079     EXPECT_EQ(workingArray1[0], 1);
00080     EXPECT_EQ(workingArray1[1], 2);
00081     EXPECT_EQ(workingArray1[3], 5);
00082 
00083     // write to the working array to make sure that we get a new one
00084     workingArray1[3] = 1.25;    
00085     EXPECT_EQ(workingArray1[3], 1.25);
00086 
00087     // calling get poly at sample re-fills all values
00088     double* workingArray2 = gen1.getPolyAtSample(0);
00089     EXPECT_EQ(workingArray2[3], 5);
00090 
00091     gen1.setParameter(aw::pNameValue, "6,5");
00092     // after setting new values, working array has not been updated    
00093     EXPECT_EQ(workingArray2[0], 1);
00094     double* workingArray3 = gen1.getPolyAtSample(0);
00095     EXPECT_EQ(workingArray2[0], 6);
00096     EXPECT_EQ(workingArray2[1], 5);
00097 
00098 
00099 }
